alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Logan; Newton (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 7:26AM CDT until March 30 at 8:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... North central Logan County in western Arkansas... Johnson County in western Arkansas... Southwestern Newton County in north central Arkansas... * Until 800 AM CDT. * At 726 AM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Denning, or near Ozark, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Subiaco... Hartman... Scranton... Woodland... Hinkle... Devils Knob... Hoyt... Spadra... Rosetta... Coal Hill... Morrison Bluff... Oak Grove in Johnson County... Catalpa... Roseville... Fort Douglas... Yale... Fallsville... Haw Creek Falls Campground... Union City... This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 45 and 59. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for western and north central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CDT for western and north central Arkansas.
